registrar_office.description: The Office of the Registrar is the nucleus of the University and coordinates all activities within and outside the University. It is the custodian of the common seal and academic records, provides secretariat support to the Board of Governors and the Vice Chancellor, and maintains the register of students and graduates. It is responsible for admissions, registration, semester enrolments, and the preparation of degrees, as well as maintaining records of students, faculty, and staff.
registrar_office.admissions_policy: Admissions are strictly based on merit. The University is open to all persons without prejudice to gender, religion, race, creed, colour, or domicile. Admission is granted on the basis of eligibility criteria. Applicants awaiting results are provisionally admitted on the undertaking that they will pass the examination, and they must submit attested copies of their certificates/degrees within two weeks of result declaration. Only complete admission formalities, including fee deposit, will lead to registration. Every undergraduate student must take the full load of prescribed courses, while a master level student may enrol for fewer courses.

online_admission_test.note: Online Admission Test will be conducted for BS Engineering & BS Computer Science, Software Engineering Programs only. A facility for on-campus test is also available.

key_points: Candidates with HSSC and Computer Science (plus Physics and Mathematics) are eligible for BS Engineering Programs.
Candidates having DAE can apply on open merit.

Candidates with Pre-Medical are eligible for BS Biomedical Engineering, and several other programs including BS Computer Science, Software Engineering, Internet of Things, Robotics & Automation, Mathematics, Islamic Studies, Accounting & Finance, Business Administration, Business Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and Cyber Security.

admission_test.general: A written Admission Test is compulsory for admissions in undergraduate engineering programs. Candidates with valid results from NAT-IE / IM / ICS / IGS / ICOM / IA / HAT / ECAT conducted by NTS, HEC, and UETs are also eligible to apply.
admission_test.test_date: Held on a prescribed date as advertised in the national press
admission_test.result_announcement: Results will be announced as per the given schedule on the University website. Selected candidates will be informed via Email and SMS, and a list of selected candidates will be displayed at the University Secretariat.
admission_test.late_admissions_policy: Late admissions are not entertained and no deviation will be made from the announced schedule. The University reserves the right to reject applications without providing a reason.

instructions: On completion of admission formalities including fee deposit, applicants will be registered as bonafide students.
Applicants must provide original academic certificates and documents at the Registrar Office during registration.
After registration, the Registrar Office will issue a University Registration Card/Identity Card.
Students are allowed to enrol in the courses offered by their department after receiving their Registration Number.
If a student fails to enrol within the first two weeks of the semester, their name may be struck off and the vacant position offered to the next candidate.
registration_and_enrollment.provisional_admission_note: All admissions will be provisional until original documents are provided.

transfer_policy: Students are generally not encouraged to shift from one discipline to another. However, in extreme circumstances, transfers within HITEC University may be allowed either within the same merit or to a discipline with lower merit upon the student's request.
